references.paper_title: Improved Algorithms for Linear Stochastic Bandits
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of linear bandits, providing improved algorithms and analysis techniques that are frequently cited and built upon in subsequent research on contextual bandits and confidence sequences.

references.paper_title: Instance-Wise Minimax-Optimal Algorithms for Logistic Bandits
references.reason: This paper significantly advanced the understanding and algorithmic approaches for logistic bandits, establishing minimax optimality results and introducing novel analysis techniques that are crucial to the current work.

references.paper_title: Using Confidence Bounds for Exploitation-Exploration Trade-offs
references.reason: This paper is highly influential in the multi-armed bandit literature, introducing the concept of upper confidence bounds and establishing a foundational understanding of the exploration-exploitation dilemma in bandit problems.

references.paper_title: Parametric Bandits: The Generalized Linear Case
references.reason: This paper is seminal in the generalization of bandit algorithms beyond linear models; it introduces the generalized linear bandit (GLB) framework, which is the primary focus of the current paper's application of confidence sequences.

This paper is foundational in the development of confidence sequences, providing early results and techniques which are extensively developed and used in more modern work on confidence sequences and their application to bandits.
